hypothesis_content.title: Holiday Lull Reversal - Post-Christmas Liquidity Return
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes with low holiday volume, a sharp intraday reversal occurs when spot BTC price drops >2.5% below its 10-day VWAP, followed by a return of institutional liquidity in the first 2 hours of London trading (08:00-10:00 UTC).
hypothesis_content.rationale: Holiday periods see exaggerated moves due to thin liquidity. Institutional desks returning after Christmas provide natural buying pressure, especially when prices dip below key volume-weighted levels. Current news mentions 'holiday lull' and ETF outflows creating temporary dislocations.
entry_conditions: BTC spot price drops >2.5% below 10-day VWAP during Asian session (00:00-08:00 UTC)
Volume ratio (current 4h / previous 4h) < 0.7 indicating holiday lull
Entry triggered at 08:00 UTC if conditions persist

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3.2% gain from entry or return above 10-day VWAP

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of signals result in continued decline through London session, or average return < 0.8% with Sharpe ratio < 0.3 over 50+ occurrences.
